result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patricia Anne Smekofske

records.addlTxt: Telephone scheduling conference on November 15, 2022 at 08:00 am.

11:11 AM Defendant Patricia Anne Smekofske in court, in custody.  Attorney Blake Duren in court for Patricia Anne Smekofske.  Attorney Michael X. Albrecht in court for State of Wisconsin.  State advises the cases are on track for a global resolution and requests the trial be reset.  Atty Duren agrees and hasn't had a chance to go over all the cases with the DE in detail.  DE wishes to have trial removed.  Court grants the request and removes the trial.  Matter will be set for a TSC.

ADDRESS INFO for Patricia Anne Smekofske
Current: P.O. Box 34, Endeavor, WI 53930 United States  (Effective: 09-19-2022)
Prior: General Delivery, Baraboo, WI 53913 United States

Motion hearing on October 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Hearing on October 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Final pre-trial on October 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial on October 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Patricia Anne Smekofske
Current: General Delivery, Baraboo, WI 53913 United States  (Effective: 05-25-2022)
Prior: 407 1/2  Oak St, # A, Baraboo, WI 53913
Telephone scheduling conference on June 7, 2022 at 08:15 am.

01:22 PM Defendant Patricia Anne Smekofske in court with attorney Blake Duren.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Duren acknowledges rec. informations in all three matters, waives reading and stands mute to all charges.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Court enters NG pleas.  TSC to be set in all three matters.

09:21 AM Attorney Blake Duren in court.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Recess.  Back on the record at 9:29 AM  Appearances remain the same but Patricia Smekofske now appears as well.   Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 3.  Atty Duren requests arraignment be set out.  Matter reset.  Bond continues.  Arraignment scheduled for March 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Not to possess any controlled substances w/o a valid prescription.  If a prescription is received the DE must maintain it in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the doctor who prescribed it.
Preliminary hearing on March 17, 2022 at 09:15 am.

02:33 PM Defendant Patricia Anne Smekofske in court, in custody from LEC w/atty. Hayes.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patricia Anne Smekofske appeared by video means.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties. Advised of rights to an attorney. DE doesn't qualify for PD representation. Atty. Duren is appointed in other cases.  DE needs to reapply.  State requests $500 Cash bond. Atty. Hayes makes argument for signature bond.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  $1000.00 SIGNATURE  bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:   Not to possess any controlled substances w/o a valid prescription.  If a prescription is received the DE must maintain it in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the doctor who prescribed it.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 09:15 am.
